intro: Pilogyne keayana, commonly known as the Malayan star anise, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruit, which resembles the spice star anise. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are small and greenish-white. The fruit develops in clusters and is harvested when it turns dark brown, indicating maturity.
